body:
HI @catubc - it's likely related to your other issue did you solve it? in maDLC one needs to use batch training, hence why we cropandlabelframes to be smaller, as many GPUs can't handle large images with the given memory. 

I don't know what's going on in your trackback (could you please follow the templates - see how I reformatted your issue. Also please don't just dump the terminal, the relevant point is the fourth set of errors you posted); seems you ran several steps (1-3), and the training_dataset was not successful at first but then you didn't crop and label, and trying batch-training with batchsize=8, and your GPU is too small to handle whatever your image sizes are, but looking massive: `[8,2048,48,60]`. 

Also, you should not just change the batch size, as you need to then change the learning rates, etc. So, really, the best path forward is to just fix the first error that your video file/unconnected parts are not allowing you to run cropandlabelframes. 

> FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/media/cat/4TBSSD/dlc_models/march_2_cat_label-cat-2020-06-11/training-datasets/iteration-0/UnaugmentedDataSet_march_2_cat_labelJun11/march_2_cat_label_cat95shuffle1.pickle'

also your graph is really under-connected:

```
 'partaffinityfield_graph': [[4, 7],
                             [10, 11],
                             [1, 2],
                             [1, 3],
                             [2, 4],
                             [0, 1],
                             [0, 2],
                             [4, 8],
                             [5, 6],
                             [8, 9],
                             [3, 7],
                             [0, 3],
                             [6, 7],
                             [4, 9],
                             [12, 13],
                             [3, 6],
                             [0, 4],
                             [4, 10],
                             [4, 5],
                             [9, 10],
                             [0, 5],
                             [11, 12],
                             [3, 5],
                             [7, 8],
                             [4, 6],
                             [3, 8],
                             [3, 4]],
```
 please read the docs where I explain it really **needs to be hyper connected!** I.e. you don't connect the ears to eachother [2, 3], etc etc... 

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/functionDetails.md#b-configure-the-project-

> Note, if you don't have uniquebodyparts please format as: uniquebodyparts: []. Also, it is crucial you connect the skeleton, and "over-connect" it, as shown above.

> HOW TO CONNECT YOUR SKELETON: For example, let's say you have the following bodyparts (left). What you might connect for plotting is in the middle, but what we ask you to do for training is on the far right (note, you can edit this after training to indeed plot just as in the middle!). You can connect the skeleton by typing the "edges" as shown above, or you can use our helper GUI (far right):

`deeplabcut.SkeletonBuilder(config_path)`

ðŸŽ¥ How to Connect The Skeleton
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/84456881-260c4480-ac2f-11ea-9cdc-c6f831f328e6.png)

rename.to: ResourceExhaustedError (see above for traceback): OOM when allocating tensor

body:
Thanks for the reply.  I have read and increased connectivity.

I did not use the Crop and Label Data because it crashed on my DLC version due to this extra "." <- period in the filename.  I don't have any idea why that is there because my data filenames do not have that extra period. 

I will start this project one more time from scratch because this crash may be related to the ":" in the filenames. I will update after just to make sure there's no real bug - and it's just errors on my end.


```

--> 370                     self.config, n_crops, (height, width), userfeedback
    371                 )

--> 382                 cfg["video_sets_original"][video_orig] = cfg["video_sets"][video_orig]

    384                 cfg["video_sets"][video_orig.replace(vidname, new_vidname)] = {

    752         try:
--> 753             return ordereddict.__getitem__(self, key)
    754         except KeyError:
    755             for merged in getattr(self, merge_attrib, []):

KeyError: '/media/cat/4TBSSD/dlc_models/movies/2020-3-8_12_08_57_943006_compressed..avi'

```

Ok, I over connected the skeletons and fixed the above DLC bug, but the memory issue is still present. 

My videos are 25FPS, and 1280 x 1024.   If they need to be 640 x 512 it becomes impossible to select eyes and ears of the animal pups.  

Any advice is appreciated. 

```

InternalError: cuDNN launch failure : input shape([8,3,262,262]) filter shape([7,7,3,64])
	 [[node resnet_v1_50/conv1/Conv2D (defined at /home/cat/code/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/nnet/pose_net.py:130) ]]
	 [[node mean_squared_error/assert_broadcastable/is_valid_shape/has_valid_nonscalar_shape/has_invalid_dims (defined at /home/cat/code/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/nnet/pose_net.py:323) ]]
...

	 [[node mean_squared_error/assert_broadcastable/is_valid_shape/has_valid_nonscalar_shape/has_invalid_dims (defined at /home/cat/code/DeepLabCut/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/nnet/pose_net.py:323) ]]

```

Ok, I've moved this project to a Titan XP with 12GB of RAM and using only 50 labeled frames it is now running.

I will proceed to scale up to a few hundred frames and hopefully that will still work. 

Thanks!
